heading: israel and the bomb
subheading: former prime minister shimon peres admitted in an interview that the jewish state began developing a "nuclear option" in the 1950s, at the controversial french-built dimona plant. then he added: "israel, by the way, never said that we have nuclear bombs." for more than 40 years israel has pursued a policy of deliberate ambiguity on its nuclear potential, although one leading expert has estimated it has some 100 weapons.
author: wired staff
